abstract: Colombian Pres Juan Manuel Santos says in interview that Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia leader Rodrigo Londono nearly backed out of deal to end decades of war because he was unaware negotiators had set six-month deadline for final accord; human rights groups have criticized deal because it offers amnesty to thousands of FARC fighters.
lead_paragraph: At the last minute, he said, a rebel leader tried to back out of a crucial part of the deal, a deadline to sign a final accord.

headline.main: Colombia’s President Says Peace Talks Overcame Late Surprise
headline.print_headline: Colombia’s President Says Peace Talks With Rebels Overcame Late Surprise

snippet: At the last minute, he said, a rebel leader tried to back out of a crucial part of the deal, a deadline to sign a final accord.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
